metadata.title: Friday, 1st August, 2025
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) why the Electoral Commission of Zambia (ECZ) has contracted Axon Global Trading Limited, a foreign-based company, to undertake the Biometric Identification Enrolment Programme for the registration of voters ahead of the 2026 General Elections;
(b) what the specific objective of the project is;
(c) how the proposed system differs from the existing digital voter registration system previously used by the ECZ;
(d) whether the ECZ engaged in consultations with relevant stakeholders prior to contracting the new service provider; and
(e) what the estimated time frame of the project is.

(a) whether the Government is aware of the road traffic accidents that have been occurring on the Chingola - Solwezi road, in Mushindamo area, with the most recent one involving a Likili bus and an abnormal load vehicle on 24th July, 2025; and
(b) what urgent measures the Government is taking to prevent further road traffic accidents.

questions.section: 5. GROUPED QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 83)
parts: (a) how many farmers were beneficiaries of the Farmer Input Support Programme (FISP) in Kalabo District, as of September, 2024;
(b) how long the beneficiaries above had been on FISP;
(c) when the farmers at (a) will be removed from the Programme to pave way for new beneficiaries;
(d) whether FISP has succeeded in enhancing food production, countrywide; and
(e) what other measures are being taken to enhance food production.

questions.section: 5. GROUPED QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 83)
parts: (a) how many farmers benefitted from the Farmer Input Support Programme during the 2024/25 farming season;
(b) whether the number of beneficiaries at (a), will be increased in the 2025/26 season;
(c) if so, to what level; and
(d) if the number will not be increased, why.

questions.section: 5. GROUPED QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 83)
parts: (a) how many farmers applied for the Sustainable Agriculture Financing Facility (SAFF) loans in Mbabala Parliamentary Constituency, as of January, 2025;
(b) how many applicants were successful;
(c) what categories of loans were applied for; and
(d) what measures are being taken to enable more farmers access the SAFF loans.

questions.section: 5. GROUPED QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 83)
questions.question_text: what measures the Government is taking to ensure that citizens, countrywide, fully utilise the Sustainable Agriculture Financing Facility loan.

questions.section: 5. GROUPED QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 83)
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to decentralise the collection of farming inputs in Namwala from the district headquarters to the wards;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
